content.description:
Follows the arête. Reach around the arête to the left for good holds and try to avoid straying to big chalky holds to the right (unless you have a lot of reach). Shares anchors with the face climb to the right, about 2-3 meters of slab from the last bolt.

If you want to have multiple people climb on top-rope, get the 3rd clip back in after each climb to avoid yanking the climber to the right.
content.protection: 3 Bolts to 2 open shuts shared with "Unknown 1" face climb to the right.
content.location: Up the arête around the corner to the right of The Power Wall, above the pool of stagnant water.

content.description:
Two new routes were put up on the face around the corner from

Electric Eye

, one goes up the arête on the left, the other up the face.  They still need a lot of cleaning, especially this one (the face route). I pulled off a key hold coming over the roof and manually removed two other loose pieces earlier on the route.  Even when clean this will be OK at best.

Half the route involves climbing up a slab filled with huge huecos; 5.7 climbing at most. By this time you will have two of the three bolts clipped. The second half of the wall goes vertical in a slight dihedral and is actually kind of fun.  Theres only about two stemming moves then you pull the roof and walk up the slab to the anchors.
content.location:
On the face around the corner from

Electric Eye

.  This route climbs the center of the face, to the right of the bolted arête.

content.description: Best route on the wall, IMHO.  Start on some smaller pockets just right of the large huecos of Power Station.  Crux at third bolt as you pull left around a protruding rock.  Joins (the better half of) Power Station after that.
content.protection: 6 bolts + anchors. Well protected, good bolts, biner and an open shut at the top.
content.location: Third route from left  (on Power Wall), just right of Power Station.

content.description: Another fun moderate.  Somewhat pumpy jug-haul, lessened considerably by the availability of many good rests on the dihedral.  Crux at the top: when you see two bolts and two anchors within 5 feet of each other, you know youre there.
content.protection: 5 bolts + anchors. Plenty of good bolts to a biner and an open shut at the top.  A bit of loose rock at the top.
content.location: Second route from the left (on Power Wall), just before the pool of water.  An obvious climb up a small dihedral littered with huge huecos.

content.description: Slightly more vertical than its neighbor to the left, work up some pockets to the small head wall. Pull that for a big ledge shared by (judging by the scat) an owl.  At this point the route meets up with Powder Puff Girls and Electric eye.  Continue up clipping one more bolt and find the anchors.
content.protection: 4 bolts + anchor.  Well protected.  Closed shut and a chain link at top.
content.location: Sixth bolt from left (on Power Wall), just right of the slab.

content.description: Yet another variation on Power Station/Rolling Blackout.  This one is up the smooth face on the right side.  Eventually cross over the spine and join the finish to the other two climbs.  Top rope only.
content.location: A variation on the smooth face to the right of Rolling Blackout.

content.description: A fun route for the grade.  Start up some large juggy huecos to a small chimney. Exit left out of the chimney sooner than you think to a couple blind jugs around the corner.  Continue up slabby face climbing to the anchors.
content.protection: 6 bolts + anchors.  All good bolts, well protected.  Open shuts at top.  A little bit of wandering and being over the water make this route a bit more difficult to top rope.  Its best to do it in pairs with a leader and a second.
content.location: The left-most route on the wall (on Power Wall), traverse about 5 feet over the water pool to a small ledge. Although not required, there is a low first bolt that the belayer can tie into and set a hanging belay over the water.  This allows the climber a bit more room to move around and makes belaying easier.

content.description: An ok warm-up traversing right over some slab to a small headwall.  Pull that for a big ledge shared by (judging by the scat) an owl.  At this point the route meets up with Power Ranger and Electric eye.  Continue up clipping one more bolt and find the anchors.
content.protection: 4 bolts + anchor.  Well protected.  Closed shut and a chain link at top.
content.location: Fifth route from left (on Power Wall), first after the blank section.  An obvious, slab start.

content.description:
A short, kind of awkward route on some underclings up mostly vertical terrain.  This route crosses the headwall after about 25 feet and joins

Powder Puff Girls

and

Power Ranger

on 5.7-ish climbing to the anchor.
content.protection: About 5 draws, all well placed for the solid part of the climb.  Rap ring anchors.
content.location: Farthest right on the main face of the Power Wall, on the vertical section just past the slab. (Some recent development has taken place farther right around the corner from this climb).
